data.event: The city became the county seat in 1839 with 110 residents and grew to 650 by 1847.
The city became the county seat in 1839 with 110 residents and grew to 650 by 1847.
Its library was established in 1853, and it held its first fair in 1854.
Its library was established in 1853, and it held its first fair in 1854.
It has received The Grassroots Rural Entrepreneurship Award, been nicknamed “silicorn valley,” and was featured in a 2012 episode of the TV show, Oprah's Next Chapter.
The city includes the $6 million Fairfield Arts & Convention Center (FACC), built in 2007.
In 2010, it was named one of six Iowa Great Places.
